Another thing you can try for free, with not much time investment is meditation. The kind doesn't really matter, although many people practice transcendental or vipassana.

It doesn't magically fix anything that's wrong with your life, it's more like booting your brain in safe mode for 10-20 minutes at a time. You get to look at the operating system of your mind from a less affected point of view. You get to see from a different angle what it is that causes your depressive thoughts. Very, very powerful tool for debugging your own mind.

That said, depression isn't a one facet problem and therefore the solution likely isn't a silver bullet either. I strongly advise you read up on meditation and give it 10 minutes of consistent effort for at least 7-10 days before choosing to not do it anymore, if you think it doesn't work for you. The earlier comment about magnesium is also good.

Depression sucks. There's help out there if you need it.
